quadratix.tabu

Class Tabu<P,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • quadratix.tabu.Tabu<P,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - Denotes the parameter type of the fitness function, that can be any elements (bits, combination, number, ...).
    R - represents the return type of the fitness function. It is often a number (integer or real).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISearch<P,R>

    public class Tabu<P,R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISearch<P,R>
    Class that implement the tabu search. The functions `search()` and its overload search the optimal point in the space of solution.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_ITERATION
      The maximum number of iterations allow in the search.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public P search(@NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                P x0,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation)
        Search the optimal point in a space of solutions.
        Specified by:
        search in interface ISearch<P,R>
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        x0 - The starting point.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        Returns:
        Return the optimal point if found.

      • search

        public P search(@NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                P x0,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation,
                int tabuSize,
                @Nullable
                R optima)
        Search the optimal point in a space of solutions.
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        x0 - The starting point.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        tabuSize - The fixed size of the tabu list. By default, the fixed size is 1.
        Returns:
        Return the optimal point if found.

      • search

        public P search(@NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                P x0,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation,
                int tabuSize,
                int maxIteration,
                @Nullable
                R optima)
        Search the optimal point in a space of solutions.
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        x0 - The starting point.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        tabuSize - The fixed size of the tabu list. By default, the fixed size is 1.
        maxIteration - The maximum number of iterations the algorithm can do.
        Returns:
        Return the optimal point if found.
